intro: Climacoptera subcrassa, commonly known as the rough-stemmed climacoptera, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its succulent nature allows it to store moisture, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Climacoptera subcrassa is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, where it thrives with minimal water input.
